messages.title: Jo Swinson’s plan for mental health:
messages.content:
1. Increase mental health staff
2. Apply the same waiting time standards to mental health care as we have for physical care
3. Ensure all GPs receive core mental health training
4. Increase access to talking therapies
5. Introduce further mental health maximum waiting time standards

messages.title: A BRIGHTER FUTURE FOR OUR MENTAL HEALTH SERVICES...
messages.content:
The NHS may be the envy of the world, but our mental health service is not. People are struggling. When they turn for help, it is often not there..
The Liberal Democrats have a plan to tackle this. They have pledged to ringfence funding for mental health and put extra investment into services. They will also ensure services run 24 hours a day, seven days a week.
The Liberal Democrats will increase mental health staffing and will ensure that, by 2025, 100% of children and young people with diagnosable conditions get NHS treatment.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Increasing the number of mental health professionals to improve services.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Apply the same waiting time standards to mental health care as we have for physical care
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Ensuring mental health patients receive timely care similar to physical health.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Ensure all GPs receive core mental health training
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Providing essential mental health training to all General Practitioners.
Enhancing availability of counseling and therapy services.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Introduce further mental health maximum waiting time standards
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Setting strict waiting time thresholds for mental health services.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Ringfence funding for mental health and put extra investment into services
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Allocating dedicated funds for mental health services, ensuring services are available 24/7.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Ensure 100% of children and young people with diagnosable conditions get NHS treatment by 2025
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Guaranteeing timely treatment for all young people with mental health issues.

issues.health: The NHS may be the envy of the world, but our mental health service is not. People are struggling. When they turn for help, it is often not there..

endorsements.endorsement: I have now found a new home within the Liberal Democrats. I am proud to join a progressive party. I left Labour as a direct consequence of the direction in which the party is heading.

The Conservatives have become a party promoting an extremist view of isolationism. It wasn’t an easy decision to make but I could no longer campaign for them. The Lib Dems are the only pro-business party left.

quotes.text: Poll reveals majority believe lying Boris Johnson will sell off NHS services to US.
